## Background

I came to law school after spending several years doing data analysis and modeling
in the physical sciences and finance. In contrast to those fields, legal practice
seemed old-fashioned. How could I automate a process? How could I make sense of
everything I was reading? Are we still in the nineteenth century or what?  For all
of its zeal to tackle new problems, law remained in many ways stuck in the past
when it came to actually doing the work. It was frustrating, and I even wrote a
[Note](https://jolt.law.harvard.edu/articles/pdf/v21/21HarvJLTech589.pdf) about
it as a kind of protest.

We're now in a different era, and the current crop of transformer-based language
models promises to make lots of ideas that were enticingly out of reach a decade
or two ago much closer. How can we take advantage of the new AI tools?

## Writing on ethics & society

- Bullock, J. et al., eds. (2022). _The Oxford Handbook of AI Governance_. Oxford Univ. Press.
[Publisher site](https://academic.oup.com/edited-volume/41989). The print version is expensive, but it should be available in electronic form through institutional libraries.
- Crawford, K. (2021). _Atlas of AI: Power, Politics, and the Planetary Costs of Artificial Intelligence_. Yale Univ. Press.
[Author's site](https://katecrawford.net).
- Dubber, M., Pasquale, F. and Das, S., eds. (2020). _Oxford Handbook of Ethics of AI_. Oxford Univ. Press.
[Publisher site](https://academic.oup.com/edited-volume/34287).
- Hern√°ndez-Cano, A. et al. (2025). _Apertus v1 Technical Report_.
[Project site](https://www.swiss-ai.org/apertus). Report on a family of language models trained by a team at EPFL and ETH Zurich with transparency and other ethical considerations top of mind.
- Lessig, L. (2006), _Code v2.0_. Basic Books.
[Author's site with full text](https://lessig.org/product/codev2/). Code may be law, but isn't the converse also true?
- Schneier, B. (2023). _A Hacker's Mind_. Norton.
[Author's site](https://www.schneier.com/books/a-hackers-mind/). Especially the chapters on law and government.
- Schneier, B. and Sanders, N. (2025). _Rewiring Democracy: How AI Will Transform Our Politics, Government, and Citizenship_. MIT Press.
[Authors' site](https://www.schneier.com/books/rewiring-democracy/).
- Vallor, S. (2024), _The AI Mirror_. Oxford Univ. Press.
[Author's site](https://www.shannonvallor.net/books.html).

## Useful tools for hacking LLMs

- [Axolotl:](https://axolotl.ai) fine-tune open-weight models.
- [DeepEval:](https://deepeval.com/) library for LLM evaluation.
- [dstack:](https://dstack.ai) orchestration for GPU workloads.
- [Hugging Face Transformers:](https://huggingface.co/docs/transformers/en/index)
swiss army knife for working with transformer models.
- [Instructor:](https://python.useinstructor.com/) provider-agnostic library for structured LLM outputs.
- [LLM:](https://llm.datasette.io/en/stable/) Simon Willison's CLI and library for
interacting with LLMs.
- [Marimo:](https://marimo.io/) reactive Python notebooks with bells and whistles.
- [nupunkt:](https://github.com/alea-institute/nupunkt) sentence boundary detection library optimized for legal texts.
- [NVIDIA DGX Spark:](https://build.nvidia.com/spark) examples and docs for GB10 developer workstations.
- [Ollama:](https://ollama.com) local LLM inference (e.g., on a laptop).
- [Pydantic AI:](https://ai.pydantic.dev) Python 'agent' framework (validation, model abstraction, evals, workflows).
- [Pytorch:](https://pytorch.org) tensor library for deep learning.
- [Textual:](https://www.textualize.io) TUI application framework ('move at terminal velocity').
- [Typer:](https://typer.tiangolo.com) Python CLI application library.
- [uv:](https://github.com/astral-sh/uv) a modern Python package manager.
- [vLLM:](https://vllm.ai) LLM inference (e.g., on NVIDIA data center GPUs).

## Data

- [Free Law Project:](https://free.law) case law database (RECAP, CourtListener, etc.).
- [HLS Caselaw Access Project:](https://case.law) scanned law books.
- [Hugging Face:](https://huggingface.co) open models and data sets.
- [KL3M:](https://kl3m.ai) free-range LLMs, with training data (lots of legal sources) on Hugging Face.
- [Pile of Law:](https://reglab.stanford.edu/data/pile-of-law/) dataset on Hugging Face.
